results.content:
Teaches people to modify 3rd party source code which in my book is extremely bad advice to give to your students.

In the Go section doesn't go over in detail why certain implementation decisions are made because he already went over it the Node section. This would be fine if I intended to do the node section but it in itself is 2 hours long.
results.content_html:
Teaches people to modify 3rd party source code which in my book is extremely bad advice to give to your students.

In the Go section doesn't go over in detail why certain implementation decisions are made because he already went over it the Node section. This would be fine if I intended to do the node section but it in itself is 2 hours long.

results.content: Pacing on this course is fantastic and the content is really good.  I am using docker-compose files to eliminate the need to spin up all those servers in the beginning.  You may want to have something similar for those of us coding Go in a windows environment :)

response.content: Thank you for the  kind words and Review Liph! Very much appreciated. I still have more plans for this course so your gesture towards a docker-compose setup just highlighted a very appropriate Note in my brain. Again thx boss!  Do people prefer one image with everything built in or docker-compose files?
